JobFullDesc: Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.Customer Success: Microsoft aspires to help our customers achieve their own digital transformation, leveraging the power of Microsoft Cloud solutions and support offerings. To this end, Microsoft invests in a dedicated Customer Success team that will help Microsoft customers successfully realize their business outcomes.Customer Engineers (CEs) are deep technical advisors supporting Enterprise customers to deliver unique value by removing blockers to consumption within their given Solution Area. CEs provide technical support including risk assessments and tuning to operate and optimize a customer’s cloud or on-premise environment. The Customer Engineer provides support delivery services as well as technical readiness through a Customer’s Support contract remotely or on-premises.ResponsibilitiesAdvocate for our customers to help resolve critical and complex technical issues using your technical proficiency combined with your understanding of our customer’s needs. Ability to go technically deep across Modern Work services and actively seek solutions to customer needs and communicate trends to leadership. Build a close working relationship with the teams related to assigned service areas to leverage in case of escalations, as well as to drive product improvements. Deeply engage with your customers. Maintain and expand accreditations/certifications and assist in developing best practices for key technologies and products. We are looking to hire a team worker that has a keen interest in proactively participating in Microsoft Communities, in recruiting activities, helping new joiners to ramp-up and/or coaching/mentoring others.QualificationsYou should bring: Solid understanding of digital transformation business drivers, cloud platforms, emerging computing trendsDemonstrated experience in an enterprise or similar environmentOutstanding analytical skills, as well as communication skills, both verbal and writtenExperience analyzing, troubleshooting, and providing solutions for technical issuesPassion for customers and focus on delivering the right customer experienceAbility and willingness to learn new technologies in a fast-paced environment Technical: Expert level covering the following technologies: Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Microsoft Intune, Configuration Manager)Windows 10 (manage and secure),  Windows-as-a-Service and Windows Update for BusinessManagement of iOS and Android Devices with Microsoft Intune (MAM / MDM)Client Security and Compliance (Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Conditional Access, Zero Trust Model)Autopilot, M365 App Deployment and Operating System Deployment (OSD) Additional to the above, very good in one or more of the following: Microsoft Azure AD,Azure Virtual Desktop,Microsoft PowerBISharepoint Online, Sharepoint OnPrem, OneDriveMicrosoft TEAMS, TEAMS as a PlatformMicrosoft VivaMicrosoft Workplace AnalyticsTroubleshooting skills across network, application, ADFS/ADExperience in Security and Compliance Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar. One or more Microsoft Certification in one of the following areas are a plus: M365: Modern Desktop Administrator AssociateM365: Security Administrator AssociateM365: Enterprise Administrator Expert  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
